title: How to prepare for email writing - Quora

response.answer_text: There is couple things you should know before you even start writing an email. The person who opens an email want to know three things, and the structure of your email has to prepared thoughtfully to show them, either way you will just bounce of his attention. Your e-mail should be clear on: who you arewhy you wrote this emailwhat’s in it for them or if they should take any action. Offer them value, or, at least, be honest, when it comes to describing your intent. Make sure that the visual structure of your message is clear and concise. Paragraphs and bullet points are your allies. If you’re looking for coherent and businesslike course on Business Email Writing, you will find more information in our free e-learning platform – LearningSpace by HelpDesk.

Depends on what content you are sending in the email! Welcome emails, automated and transactional emails, abandoned cart emails, or product announcements will all have different and unique copy, and you will need to prepare for them each. To start, I would recommend checking out SendGrid’s guide to email copywriting. Here are some tips from Campaign Monitor too: 8 Email Copywriting Tips for Engaging Content [+ Examples] Some other tips: You can be both clever and clear, but you cannot be clever without being clear. Always keep your brand voice in mind and write like you speak.A/B test the length of your email copy.Your subject line is copy too - be sure to spend some quality time writing a good one.Don’t forget your preheader text.Use the PAS method.PAS stands for “Problem-Agitate-Solve” and is not only incredibly simple, but also extremely effective.The formula breaks down as follows:Problem: Identify a problemAgitate: Agitate that problemSolve: Find and present the solutionHope this helps. Happy emailing!
